data.author: David Yackzan
data.message:
Update gripper descriptions for use on HW (#206)

Pass though more hardware parameters for gripper control:
* `use_internal_bus_gripper_comm`: specify if gripper comms will pass
  through the robot internally
* `(gripper_)com_port`: specify the port the gripper can be exected on

Use internal comm param in gripper macros:
* Consider `use_internal_bus_gripper_comm` param in determination
  for whether or not to launch a ros2_control instance for the gripper. If
  `use_internal_bus_gripper_comm` is false and we're not running in
  simulation, that means we're expecting to communicate with the gripper
  via USB and we'll need to launch a separate ros2_control instance to
  control it.

Add documentation on `load_robot` macro parameters

data.author: Alex Moriarty
data.message:
cxx: remove unused-but-set-parameter (#164)

- kortex_math_util.cpp originates from the original ros_kortex
- modifies pre-commit-config because cpplint has false readability/casting error

This kortex_math_util function comes from the ros_kortex repo and is actually unimplemented
leaving it as is and ignoring the warning to keep ros2_kortex and ros_kortex similar

data.author: Alex Moriarty
data.message:
[CI] ament_lint_cmake skip kortex_drivers (#163)

ament_lint_cmake fails due to to known readability/wonkycase
1. FetchContent_Declare
2. FetchContent_MakeAvailable

These mix CamelCase_And_Underscores

Error: kortex_driver/CMakeLists.txt:3: Do not use mixed case commands [readability/wonkycase]
Error: kortex_driver/CMakeLists.txt:8: Do not use mixed case commands [readability/wonkycase]

I couldn't find a way to disable this via an argument.
This test is also skipped via ".pre-commit-config.yaml" on this directory

Signed-off-by: Alex Moriarty <alex.moriarty@picknik.ai>

data.author: Alex Moriarty
data.message:
Change kortex_api header and library install locations (#156)

This commit does several two main things:

1) kortex_api now only installs the header files and they now do not pollute include
2) kortex_driver gets the binary libKortexApiCpp.a itself

kortex_driver gets the headers from kortex_api this avoids protobuf errors because
those header files and the libKortexApiCpp.a were generated using non-system protobuf

kortex_api cannot install the libKortexApiCpp.a because CMake does not allow installing library which was IMPORTED

This should fix the debian packages which are currently released

Signed-off-by: Alex Moriarty <alex.moriarty@picknik.ai>

data.author: Alex Moriarty
data.message:
Fixes handling dof:=6 in sim (#131)

This fixes up the issue where dof arg was not being taken into account
in sim due to how python launch files work this is a larger change than
expected.

See the following ros answers for more details

1. https://answers.ros.org/question/396345/ros2-launch-file-how-to-convert-launchargument-to-string/
2. https://answers.ros.org/question/397123/how-to-access-the-runtime-value-of-a-launchconfiguration-instance-within-custom-launch-code-injected-via-an-opaquefunction-in-ros2/

Signed-off-by: Alex Moriarty <alex.moriarty@picknik.ai>

* Add import-token to action-ros-ci
* CI update branch name master->main

- Trigger humble jobs on both humble and main
- Trigger rolling on main

* Trigger rolling source build on PRs to main

- source job was only triggered on master because it is slower.
- triggering it on PRs for now while we're actively working towards
  release

* use ${{ github.workspace }} to find repos file

- vcs or actions-ros-ci seem to have trouble pulling the private repos
file via https
- find it locally using github.workspace which is made available by
  actions/checkout step above

* This token is needed because this repo is private

---------

Signed-off-by: Alex Moriarty <alex.moriarty@picknik.ai>

data.author: Alex Moriarty
data.message:
Fixup ci (#84)

* Remove EOL ROS 2 Galactic

Drop Galactic and sync all versions in ros2_kortex.repos to rolling

* Use consistent version of actions/checkout@v3

* use latest ros-tooling/setup-ros@v0.6

* Update actions to ros-tooling/action-ros-ci@v0.3

* commit flake8 changes

* pre-commit wrap long comment lines for linter

* update pre-commit hooks and configure flake8

- The version of pep257 was very old and pointed to a fork
  - https://github.com/FalconSocial/pre-commit-mirrors-pep257/issues/7

- flake8 W504 and W503 conflict
- black and flake8 conflict
  - https://github.com/psf/black/blob/main/docs/guides/using_black_with_other_tools.md#flake8

* CI bump ubuntu 20.04 -> 22.04

* revert back to 20.04 for lint job

Need to look into why setup this fails on 22.04 later.
ros2_control also runs the linter in 20.04 and the ci in 22.04 so maybe
it is a known issue

data.author: Denis Štogl
data.message:
Kortex simulations (#64)

* Adjust URDF and launch files for Gazebo and Ignition simulations.

* Add simulation dependecies until released.

* Correct name of controllers URDF argument.

* Fix repos lines.

* Using gen3 per default in launch files and do not use any gripper. Kinematics file was adjusted because it results somehow in the wrong type.

* Add ros_ign in .repos file.

* Add delay before starting rviz to avoid warning that joint-values are not available.

* Use sustitutions for kinematics_yaml instead of file parsing to have correct parameter types.

* fix ign_ros2_control to working hash.

* Fixup rviz default rviz configuration when moveit is not used.

* Do not add camera links because they are and should be added by camera URDF itself.

* Add updated for the simulation.

* Update simulation repositories.

* Add rezilient setup here as workarround.

* Updated to work again and updated simulation parameters.

* remove temp rezilinet file.

* Update urls and versions. (#67)

* Correct Ignition plugin name for ros2_control support.

* Correct joint names for testing node.

* Fix pre-commit.

* Update docs for simulation purposes.

Co-authored-by: Lovro <lovro.ivanov@gmail.com>
